bibl.title: Developing onomastic gazetteers and prosopographies for the ancient world through named entity recognition and graph visualization: some examples from Trismegistos People
bibl.seg: Yanne Broux & Mark Depauw, Developing Onomastic Gazetteers and Prosopographies for the Ancient World through Named Entity Recognition and Graph Visualization: Some Examples from Trismegistos People.

Luca Maria Aiello & Daniel McFarland (edd.), Social Informatics. SocInfo 2014 International Workshops Barcelona, Spain, November 10, 2014. Revised Selected Papers = Lecture Notes in Computer Science. 8852 (Berlin - Heidelberg 2015) pp. 304-313, figg.

1. Introduction. - 2. Named Entity Recognition for Onomastic Gazetteers: 2.1. Creating a Multi-tiered Onomastic Gazetteer; - 2.2. Distilling Genealogical Information from Identifications; - 2.3. Human Intervention for Quality Control and Intratextual Identification. - 3. Data Visualization and Network Analysis to Assist the Creation of Prosopographies: 3.1. The Problem of Homonymy; - 3.2. Network Visualization; - 3.3. Letters from Elephantine. - 4. Conclusion.
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Named Entity Recognition for Onomastic Gazetteers: 2.1. Creating a Multi-tiered Onomastic Gazetteer; - 2.2. Distilling Genealogical Information from Identifications; - 2.3. Human Intervention for Quality Control and Intratextual Identification. - 3. Data Visualization and Network Analysis to Assist the Creation of Prosopographies: 3.1. The Problem of Homonymy; - 3.2. Network Visualization; - 3.3. Letters from Elephantine. - 4. Conclusion.
